name: The Chalk Giant
tagline: Flocks of crows caw and wheel above rugged chalk downs. Beds of gorse and twisted blue thistle.

procedural.encounter_notes: Encounters are 2-in-6 likely to be with a peryton

description: Flocks of crows caw and wheel above rugged chalk downs. Beds of gorse and twisted blue thistle.

points_of_interest.name: The Chalk Giant
points_of_interest.description: A humanoid figure, 200′ high, framed by a doorway, occupies the side of a hill, carved into the chalk beneath the turf of the downs. It is visible for miles around.
points_of_interest.entering: If the giant's name—Talorch—is called, he magically animates and opens the doorway behind him, revealing a shimmering portal to the Crystal Cave.
points_of_interest.inhabitants: The lost scholar: Crouched atop the hill is the Lost Scholar. He may spot PCs and wave to them excitedly.
special_features: Secret door activated by calling the name 'Talorch'

points_of_interest.name: The Perytons' Nest
points_of_interest.description: In the south-western reaches of the hex stands a 100′ sheer bluff. Atop sits a massive nest of brambles and boughs.
points_of_interest.inhabitants: 5 perytons (DMB). Three dead bramblings (DMB) are incorporated into the materials of the nest. One clutches a scroll sealed in a tube.
special_features: Scroll with descriptions of crystalline dream-world and drawings of Talorch

points_of_interest.name: The Crystal Cave
points_of_interest.description: Through the door in the Chalk Giant is a vast cave, its walls entirely encrusted in large purple and mauve crystals. An old man with the same face as the Lost Scholar appears in the reflection of the crystals, dressed in black hooded robes. He introduces himself as Alhair, a Drune.
points_of_interest.entering: Accessed through the portal opened by the Chalk Giant
points_of_interest.interior: Vast cave with walls entirely encrusted in large purple and mauve crystals
points_of_interest.inhabitants: Alhair appears in the reflection of the crystals
special_features: Crystals with legendary powers of eternal life that forever entrap the soul
secrets: Alhair was trapped by an experiment with the crystals

npcs.name: The Lost Scholar
npcs.title: Dream Projection
npcs.description: An old, bearded human man, hunched and weary. He wears a tattered purple and mauve hooded robe. Claims to be the last survivor of a group of scholars from the land of Wyggrabole (a place not known to the PCs), who had come to study the Chalk Giant. All but he were eaten by a flock of perytons.
demeanor: cannot even remember his own name
desires: Begs PCs to retrieve from the Perytons' Nest his notes detailing his 'extraordinary findings'
help him find his way back to Wyggrabole
secrets: The man is a dream projection of Alhair, the Drune trapped in the Crystal Cave
If PCs return to the spot where they met him, he has vanished
npcs.location: Atop the hill by the Chalk Giant

npcs.name: Alhair
npcs.title: Ancient Drune
npcs.description: An ancient Drune who was alive at the creation of the Ring of Chell (p20). Appears in the reflection of the crystals, dressed in black hooded robes.
npcs.speech: Calm, warm whisper, punctuated with cheerful laughter uncharacteristic of Drune. Woldish, Drunic, Old Drunic.
desires: He does not wish to be freed, and is happy here in his crystal dream world
secrets: Trapped here by an experiment involving the crystals' legendary powers of eternal life
His bramblings were tasked to bring a scroll to the Drune Lodge (hex 0507), but were waylaid by the perytons

items.name: Emeralds
items.description: 3 emeralds found in the Perytons' Nest

items.name: Silver pieces
items.description: Sack of silver pieces found in the Perytons' Nest

items.name: Scroll in sealed tube
items.description: Descriptions of a crystalline dream-world of eternal life, in Drunic, as well as several drawings of the Chalk Giant, who is referred to as 'Talorch.'

secrets: The Lost Scholar is a dream projection of Alhair
The crystals in the Crystal Cave trap souls forever
